**Python Package Choices**

1.  Package for leetspeak decoding

-   **Name:** floft/leetspeak (<https://github.com/floft/leetspeak>)
-   **Author:** floft
-   **Purpose:** a leetspeak to english translator that uses the
    probability of word usage taken from the Project Gutenberg from all
    the possibilities it can generate Package for leetspeak decoding

2.  Another package for leetspeak decoding

-   **Name:**floft/leetspeak(<https://github.com/Monotoba/leetspeak-encoder-decoder>)
-   **Author:**Monotoba
-   **Purpose:** a leetspeak to multiple languages translator that
    allows for encoding and decoding leetspeak. The package also has a
    dictionary for multiple character replacements in different
    languages and can identify the correct character and language based
    on language identifiers

3.  Package for fuzzy matching (calculates difference or similarity
    between two strings)

-   **Name:** RapidFuzz
    (<https://pypi.org/project/RapidFuzz/#description>)
-   **Author:** Max Bachmann
-   **Purpose:** Calculates similarity or “distance” between two or more
    strings and assigns a score/ratio based on this distance. Builds off
    of string similarities calculations from FuzzyWuzzy library

4.  Package for fuzzy matching (calculates difference or similarity
    between two strings)

-   **Name:** TheFuzz (<https://pypi.org/project/thefuzz/>)
-   **Author:** Adam Cohen
-   **Purpose:** Uses Levenshtein distance to calculate similarity or
    “distance” between strings and assigns a score/ratio based on this
    distance. Package for pyleetspeak (prob not since for encoding not
    decoding)

5.  Leetspeak encoder(this may not be useful for our project)

-   **Name:** pyleetspeak (<https://github.com/Huertas97/pyleetspeak>)
-   **Author:** Álvaro Huertas García
-   **Purpose:**
